unnormalised: So, someone asked about online shopping experiences in India. Mine are...mixed. I ordered a new phone cover from Flipkart last week. The listing said it was ₹299, with free shipping. Seemed like a good deal.
normalised: So, someone asked about online shopping experiences in India. Mine are...mixed. I ordered a new phone cover from F-L-I-P-K-A-R-T last week. The listing said it was rupee two hundred and ninety nine, with free shipping. Seemed like a good deal.

unnormalised: The delivery estimate was 3-5 days. On day 6, still nothing. Checked the tracking info - “out for delivery” since yesterday. Called the customer service, waited for like 20 mins, then got connected to a rep who said, "Sir, it will be delivered by today evening, surely 100%." That "100%" is always a red flag, right?
normalised: The delivery estimate was three to five days. On day six, still nothing. Checked the tracking info dash “out for delivery” since yesterday. Called the customer service, waited for like twenty minutes, then got connected to a rep who said, "Sir, it will be delivered by today evening, surely one hundred percent." That "one hundred percent" is always a red flag, right?

unnormalised: Surprise, surprise, it wasn't delivered. Next day, I finally got it. The cover was actually pretty good, exactly as described. BUT, the delivery guy asked for Rs. 50 extra because "sir, petrol cost bahut badh gaya hai." I argued, saying shipping was free. He kept insisting. Finally, I just paid him ₹349 total and let it go.
normalised: Surprise, surprise, it wasn't delivered. Next day, I finally got it. The cover was actually pretty good, exactly as described. Finally, I just paid him rupee three hundred and forty nine total and let it go.

unnormalised: So, yeah, the product was good, the price (eventually) was fine, but the delivery experience was a bit of a headache. 6/10. Would I order from Flipkart again? Probably, but I’d prepone my expectations for delays and random "delivery charges." It's just part of the Indian online shopping charm, I guess.
